comments.body: Exposed as a property so it can be mocked in tests

The documented behavior of `LocalArtifactRepository.download_artifacts()` will now differ significantly from `ArtifactRepository.download_artifacts()` (https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/4ef4078e2996f43cef1067953cbe84c862268fee/mlflow/store/artifact_repo.py#L67-L70). 

Can we update the description of the behavior of `ArtifactRepository.download_artifacts()` so that the `LocalArtifactRepository` implementation conforms to it?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +47,51 @@
        :param artifact_path: Relative source path to the desired artifacts.
        :param dst_path: Absolute path of the local filesystem destination directory to which to
                         download the specified artifacts. This directory must already exist. If
                         unspecified, the absolute path of the local artifact will be returned.

comments.body: I think this is a little confusing because the `:return:` docs indicate that the method always returns an absolute path on the local filesystem. Can we specify that, because the artifact already exists on the local filesystem, the method will return the pre-existing path?
Why is this confusing? It does indeed always return an absolute path on the local filesystem containing the artifacts. Maybe it's the `downloaded` word that's confusing?

This is confusing because we're expressing this as if it's special case return behavior, but the language doesn't differ substantially from the language described in `:return:`. The difference to me isn't clear.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@        :param dst_path: Absolute path of the local filesystem destination directory to which to
                         download the specified artifacts. This directory must already exist. If
                         unspecified, the absolute path of the local artifact will be returned.

        :return: Absolute path of the local filesystem location containing the desired artifacts.
